bill_title: to allow the city of Huron to issue a temporary liquor license to be operated within the South Dakota State Fairgrounds.

bill_versions.bill_text: FOR AN ACT ENTITLED, An Act to allow the city of Huron to issue a temporary liquor license to be operated within the South Dakota State Fairgrounds. BE IT ENACTED BY THE LEGISLATURE OF THE STATE OF SOUTH DAKOTA: Section 1. The governing body of the city of Huron may issue one on-sale license to be operated within the South Dakota State Fairgrounds for any entertainment or convention event. The city may issue the license for a period not to exceed five consecutive days and the license shall expire at twelve o'clock midnight on the fifth day. No alcoholic beverage may be sold, served, or dispensed more than one hour before the start of the event or at any time after the event is concluded. The sale of the alcoholic beverage shall be made within areas designated for that purpose. The license shall be available at any time, except when the state fair is in operation pursuant to § 1-21-9. No public hearing is required for the issuance of a license pursuant to this section if the person applying for the license holds an on-sale beverage license in the city of Huron or holds an operating agreement for a municipal on-sale alcoholic beverage license. 750 copies of this document were printed by the South Dakota Legislative Research Council at a cost of $.015 per page. . Insertions into existing statutes are indicated by underscores. Deletions from existing statutes are indicated by overstrikes.

action_log.status_text: First read in Senate and referred to
Scheduled for Committee hearing on this date
